Articles.Content:
Chem lab #6 let\'s see what we have in store this week...

Nitration of Benzene

hm okay an easy reaction if I recall correctly

Involves:

Nitric Acid mixed with Sulfuric Acid

dangerous already I see

Heating the mixed acids in solution with highly combustible hexanes which may be toxic if inhaled

alright...

Highly toxic Nitrogen Dioxide gases released during the reaction

>_>

.5g of Nitronapthalene, a suspected carcinogen, is added to the mixture

T-T

I don\'t think I\'ll be leaving this lab alive.
Don\'t you have any lizergid acid there? :

I didn\'t die!

Although I almost did.

Basically while we were heating our mixture of Nitric Acid, Sulfuric Acid, and Nepthalene (the carcinogen) this happened.

Except thank god it shot straight up and not all over us.

And of course, it wasn\'t water that was exploding.

It was a hyperboiling, extremely acidic carcinogenic mixture.

...
Just curious, is this in high school or college?

College lol.

Organic Chemistry 202

So much better than Orgo 201...
